meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or incompetent.
meanings.sent1: The new employee felt like a mungo in the office.
meanings.sent2: Don't worry, everyone starts as a mungo at some point.
meanings.sent3: The mungo tried to fix the printer but ended up making it worse.
meanings.sent4: He was a mungo in the kitchen, causing chaos wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The mungo's mistakes were so obvious, they became a running joke in the team.

meanings.definition: To make a mess of something.
meanings.sent1: Please don't mungo the puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent2: I always manage to mungo up my room before cleaning it.
meanings.sent3: She somehow managed to mungo her hair while trying a new hairstyle.
meanings.sent4: The chef accidentally mungoed the recipe, creating a strange dish.
meanings.sent5: His attempt to fix the leak only ended up mungoing the entire plumbing system.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric made from recycled fibers.
meanings.sent1: The jacket was made from soft mungo material.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to buy clothes made from sustainable mungo.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer showcased a collection using colorful mungo.
meanings.sent4: The cozy blanket was crafted from warm mungo fabric.
meanings.sent5: The store promoted their new line of eco-friendly mungo products.

meanings.definition: A type of bean commonly used in Indian cuisine.
meanings.sent1: The chef added mungo beans to the curry for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: Have you ever tried cooking with mungo in your dishes?
meanings.sent3: The aroma of the simmering mungo filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: She learned a new recipe featuring spicy mungo beans.
meanings.sent5: The market sold fresh mungo beans for traditional Indian recipes.
